Tanmay Shah Cleveland City Council

Tanmay Shah is running for Cleveland City Council in Ward 12 to fight for the working class.

Donate Volunteer

About Tanmay

Tanmay Shah is a union organizer, lawyer, and truck driver who wants every single Clevelander to have affordable housing, affordable groceries, and reliable city services.

How to pronounce my name:

Tanmay biography

Tanmay Shah is a Jefferson neighborhood homeowner and democratic socialist running for Cleveland City Council in Ward 12. He is a proud immigrant from India who has called Northeast Ohio home for almost 15 years. Tanmay is committed to fighting for the working class in Cleveland â€” from defending tenants against unethical landlords in housing court to organizing a union at the fifth oldest legal aid organization in the United States.

The problems facing Cleveland are no secret: people and jobs have been leaving for decades. Instead of investing in housing, food access, and city services (such as composting or public transit) for working class families, City Hall has prioritized stadiums, tax breaks, and luxury development for the wealthy. Tanmay believes our city government can improve our lives and help our neighborhoods prosper. He will fight to make sure the people of Ward 12 have safe and affordable housing, groceries, and reliable city services.

About Ward 12

The new Ward 12 on the West side of Cleveland starts at the Linndale border and includes Edgewater, Cudell, and West Boulevard into Jefferson.
